page.title: 03STARRICKS FARM
page.content: This farm is a dairy producing farm and is sixty acres in size.It faces South and gets more sunlight .The farmer owns twenty six cows and only three of them are for beef.The cows are milked twice a day,once at six o'clock in the morning and again a four o' clock in the afternoon. Each milking lasts about an hour.In one day four hundred litres of milk are produced which means that on average a cow gives twenty two and a half litres approximately. A good, young cow can give about fifty litres. This milk goes to the creamery at Kendal.While being milked the cows eat dairy pencil which is a piece of barley shaped like a pencil.Also they eat hay. This is grown in the meadows during the Spring and at the beginning of June it is cut.(cont)
